member.typeparam: The type of object which is being pooled.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.ObjectPool.DefaultPooledObjectPolicy`1.Return(`0)
member.summary: Runs some processing when an object is returned to the pool. Can be used to reset the state of an object and indicate if the object should be returned to the pool.
member.param: The object to return to the pool.
member.returns: true if the object should be returned to the pool. false if it's not possible or desirable for the pool to keep the object.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.ObjectPool.IPooledObjectPolicy`1
member.summary: Represents a policy for managing pooled objects.
member.typeparam: The type of object which is being pooled.

member.summary: Runs some processing when an object was returned to the pool. Can be used to reset the state of an object and indicate if the object should be returned to the pool.
member.param: The object to return to the pool.
member.returns: if the object should be returned to the pool. if it's not possible/desirable for the pool to keep the object.

member.summary: Defines a method to reset an object to its initial state.

member.returns: if the object was able to reset itself, otherwise .

member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.ObjectPool.LeakTrackingObjectPool`1
member.summary:
An implementation that detects leaks in the use of the object pool.
A leak is produced if an object is leased from the pool but not returned before it is finalized. An error is only produced in Debug builds. This type is only recommended to be used for diagnostic builds.
member.typeparam: The type of object which is being pooled.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.ObjectPool.LeakTrackingObjectPool`1.#ctor(Microsoft.Extensions.ObjectPool.ObjectPool{`0})
member.param: The instance to track leaks in.
